teamMembers.name: Fabiola Fabian Plascencia
teamMembers.bio: As project director, I manage SolarPack's administration, coordinate collaboration between teams, and keep us true to our core mission of practical sustainability. I joined SolarPack because I want to use my mechanical engineering degree to contribute to the creation and implementation of sustainable practices. The engineers I admire the most are those who carefully consider how their designs will impact people in unexpected ways, both in the present and in the future. In my free time, I enjoy listening to musicals, playing video games, and watching Disney movies.

teamMembers.name: Will Shearin
teamMembers.bio: As Technical Director, I manage a team of students whose responsibility is to model, test, and fabricate the chassis, roll cage, and other mechanical structures of the car, while also coordinating efforts across all engineering teams. I am currently a senior in mechanical engineering, and I joined SolarPack right after my sophomore year. I took over as Technical Director after my junior year and have really enjoyed all my time here. I can see how my classroom skills translate into real-world environments, and how I can contribute to promoting sustainability. In my free time, I enjoy hanging out with friends and cooking.

teamMembers.name: Maghen Lahoud
teamMembers.bio: As the aero team lead, I oversee the development of the aeroshell through 3D modeling and composite manufacturing. I joined SolarPack as a freshman because it aligns with my goal of eventually working in aerospace sustainability. Now, as a sophomore, I feel I've gained valuable technical and interpersonal skills while on the team. Outside of SolarPack, I enjoy hiking, swimming, traveling, trying new foods, and collecting rocks.

teamMembers.name: Nathan Hambleton
teamMembers.bio: As High Voltage Lead, I'm responsible for the car's main power and propulsion systems—the 3‑phase motor, inverter, battery pack, and protection systems. I am a senior in electrical engineering and this is my 4th year in the club. I started out in vehicle dynamics but have since transitioned to high voltage systems. I will also jump in on low‑voltage, building firmware, controls, and interfaces, and I help out with our website and app code when needed.

teamMembers.name: Matt Pugliese
teamMembers.bio: As the Low Voltage lead, I manage the systems of the car that allow it to charge using solar energy, as well as the design and communication of the car's low voltage accessory systems. I joined solarpack during my freshman year because of my interest in renewable energy and love of motorsports. I am currently a senior in electrical engineering with a focus in power systems engineering. Solarpack has given me a lot of hands-on experience and knowledge of hardware and software design outside of classes. Some of my hobbies include playing video games, racquetball, and gardening

teamMembers.name: Max Weiser
teamMembers.bio: As the Systems Architecture lead, I lead the development of communication and telemetry systems in the car. I joined SolarPack during the first semester of my freshman year because I was fascinated with the concept of making an electric car fun to drive. During my time with SolarPack, I have learned many skills and gained experiences that I would have never received in my classes. For example, I am now capable of designing and building PCBs, operating HAM radio, and so much more. During my free time, I enjoy playing video games, watching anime, and cooking.

teamMembers.name: Ansh Aggarwal
teamMembers.bio: As the Structures Lead, I oversee the creation and development of most immobile mechanical structures present in the car, involving structures such as the chassis, doors, and battery enclosures. I am a sophomore in chemical engineering and paper science engineering, and this is my 2nd year on SolarPack. I joined SolarPack as it reminded me of FRC, a robotics competition I invested lots of time and effort in in high school. Some of my hobbies include woodworking, reading, and playing videogames.

teamMembers.name: Aaron Wold
teamMembers.bio: As the vehicle dynamics team lead, I oversee the development of mechanical aspects within the car, involving systems such as suspension, steering, and powertrain. My interest in these systems stemmed from my interest in LEGO as a child. My other hobbies include playing guitar, playing videogames, and skateboarding.

teamMembers.name: Aaron Yang
teamMembers.bio: As the business team lead, I oversee sponsorship, finance, social media, and outreach events for SolarPack. I am a sophomore majoring in Business Administration with a concentration in Finance. Originally, I was going to major in Mechanical Engineering given my interest in cars and combustion engines. I enjoy playing games, food, and learning to cook foods.
